events.message: Customer reported a car accident involving a rear-end collision at a traffic signal causing visible damage to the back bumper and trunk.
The claim was reviewed and categorized under Auto Accident based on keywords describing vehicle collision and damage.
A claims agent specializing in auto damage has been assigned to handle this case for further investigation and support.
The customer received confirmation that their claim for the vehicle accident has been formally acknowledged by the insurer.
Insurance company requested photos of the damaged vehicle, police report, and repair estimates to proceed with claim assessment.
Customer submitted all requested documentation including photos, official accident report, and preliminary mechanic evaluation.
Claims investigator initiated a detailed review of submitted documents and verified accident circumstances with third parties involved.
Investigation confirmed liability and extent of damage consistent with provided evidence and statements from involved parties.
A settlement offer was presented to the customer outlining the compensation amount for vehicle repair and related expenses.
Customer responded with acceptance of the settlement proposal and expressed satisfaction with the quick processing of their claim.
The claim was formally approved by the claims manager, authorizing the payment to cover the repair costs.
Payment has been issued to the customer’s designated bank account to cover vehicle repairs and associated expenses.
The claim case has been closed after confirming the customer received the payment and completed necessary repairs.
All documents and case files related to this auto accident claim have been archived in the insurer’s repository.
